name: ArtifactoryPython
description: Build and publish Python packages from and to Artifactory while allowing to collect build-info. The collected build-info can be later published to Artifactory by the "Artifactory Publish Build Info" task.
author: JFrog

inputs.name: artifactoryService
inputs.label: Artifactory service
inputs.helpMarkDown: Artifactory service to run the command against.

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: The arguments which will be passed to pip for execution.

inputs.name: buildName
inputs.label: Build name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Build name.
To use the default build name of the pipeline, set the field to '$(Build.DefinitionName)'.
The collected build-info should be published to Artifactory using the 'Artifactory Publish Build Info' task.

inputs.name: buildNumber
inputs.label: Build number
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Build number.
To use the default build number of the pipeline, set the field to '$(Build.BuildNumber)'.
The collected build-info should be published to Artifactory using the 'Artifactory Publish Build Info' task.

inputs.name: includeEnvVars
inputs.label: Include environment variables
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select to include environment variables in the published build info.

inputs.name: noPipCache
inputs.label: Disable local pip cache
inputs.helpMarkDown: Prevents pip from using cached packages.

inputs.name: workingDirectory
inputs.label: Working Directory.
inputs.helpMarkDown: The working directory where the command will run. When empty, the value of '$(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)' is used.
